sourceMeaningMnemonic: Using just <radical>thread</radical> <radical>meeting</radical> the paper (with a little ink on the end) you create a masterpiece of a <kanji>drawing</kanji> (or a <kanji>painting</kanji>).
meaningInfo: It's unbelievable the kind of drawing you're able to draw with just the tip of a thread. So much detail. So artistic. If it helps, imagine that you drew the Mona Lisa, better than the original, only using this floppy thread tool.
readingMnemonic: You tell someone that you drew this <kanji>drawing</kanji> only using a thread. Their response? "<reading>EH</reading>?!?!?" (<ja>え</ja>)
readingInfo: Tell a few more people how you drew this. Have them all do the same "Eh!!??" reaction.
